text:
HS team, stop doing magic tricks with our custom modules please, I need to work... stop making them disappear in the finder!
I can't clone neither to a different portal etc. All of those options are gone (because those are only accessible within the finder)
thank God I’m not seeing this issue right now
sounds awful

Hey Joel! Yes, this was reported slightly below this thread over here <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C960Q64G4/p1548439047199900> the issue should be resolved but let me know if you're still seeing it on your end.

There is a way to copy the content of a module into the translated page?

I just did a new module, put all the content in the main language and I was looking for if there is way to “clone” that populated module into the translated page
thx in advance

<@UFH0PPMEW> you can clone an entire page, and then in page translation settings select `choose master` and then set the language of the current mage and the select the page you cloned from as a master
I believe that should do what you're looking for

<@U54TVT3C1> thanks, I know, but is not that i was looking for…

I have already the page translated in many languages, but we have a new module with new content, and when I add it to the main language, it won’t reflect also to the translated pages…
ahh... nevermind then
Thx anyway :slightly_smiling_face:

So one of my folders in the design manager just 'disappeared.' I can still find the files with the search option, but the client uses the modules too within the design manager so this is quite frustrating. I contacted support already.
Hopefully they can help fix this issue :crossed_fingers:
We had the same problem earlier today too. Hope they resolve this soon :eyes:
:pray:
I'm looking into the modules/folders issue- will give you a shout when I know more!
Not sure if this is related to the above issue, but I cloned a module and it isn’t showing up in the left sidebar, even though I can edit and save it normally.
I refreshed to see if it would make a difference and another one of my modules disappeared :confused:
They show up if I search for them strangely.
Yup, definitely related <@U26DA9CQ0>, we messed up some folder ids. Fix in the works, super sorry about that!
No worries, thanks Michele!
The above should be all set! We moved anything impacted by this to the root folder, but if I can help anyone move things back around, feel free to shoot me a DM.
thanks!
So I have my blog content under a container and another class, changing the width so I can keep the content contained <https://gyazo.com/bae1646becc1535b5d13506b1d69991e>
However at end of the post I want to create a module that goes full width of the viewport going outside of the container so it's full width of the viewport

I have it created statically and I have no issues in creating the module using the code I've done,, but is there a way to somehow have the module go full width because it's going to be inside of the article
So the end result I want to do something like this <https://gyazo.com/09c37907f394094efb58a3941c229013>
Now if I add what is going to be the module to the current article I get this <https://gyazo.com/f0715ac616ccd830367b4501ff06589f> but I need it to "break free" from any restrictions
Not sure if there's anything I can do in HubSpot to split the content in the blog editor
heya, i just had 2 modules move on me portal 2883648
i will move em back, but thought you should know
<@UBFA10FMF>
:eyes:
happened within the last hour

Hi everyone! I was wondering if anyone could help me discover why the featured image is coming up blurry and/or how I could discover what the required dimensions should be? I'm not sure if this is translating directly from my article listing or if this has something to do with the actual landing page template.
link to a preview would help if possible
HubSpot has resizing image built in which could be the cause but hard to guess at
Hi Joel, it's live: <https://info.propertycouncil.com.au/property-australia-blog>
yep so the source image is 640 x 240 and being stretched up to fill the space available so it's getting blurry
Is there any way to know what the recommended image size would be for these featured images on the landing page?

You'd want to replace the image with a bigger one - you'd have to guess a good enough size as that feature spot has no max width. and then maybe add a note somewhere for the team to understand the best image size to upload to blogs
For something that stretches like this, I'd normally size an image around 1600px wide and try to keep the image under 300kb
Thank you! I'll give it a shot
That did the trick! thanks heaps :slightly_smiling_face:
no worries
Don't worry about it being too big. HubSpot will help you there. Will make src set automatically and webp where possible. Huzzah!
